title: Why does Riot LIE about the 0.006% of players that get perma'd?
body: Anybody from Riot actually got some statistics for me?

replies.body:
I don't see you providing any statistics, either.
Does that mean you are lying, too?

Besides, what do you even mean with statistics? "0.006% of players get permabanned" **is** a statistic, and you choose not to believe it. Why would you believe the other statistics they share with you?

That said, my post is more about the kind of logic OP employs. Especially considering it's obvious that giving out more statistics would not actually change OP's mind, because he'd just call Riot out on "lying" again.

Because as mentioned before, it hasn't changed since the days of Tribunal. 500k is still far to small a number compared to 80 mil worldwide. TBH idgaf about any region other than my own because the game originated here and if you isolated our region, I bet the statistic goes up to about 30%. I am a season 3 player. 5 accounts banned. Why? Cause "going aggro in chat" is the crime. Not actually typing insults or saying bad words. I have seen the same message over and over and over and over again. I'm not toxic. I just use chat too much.  

So lemme explain, that means for just typing and being disliked by only ONE person out of the 4 - cause it only takes one report apparently, which is bs cause one honor should negate the report in all honesty cause at least one mature person thought you were swell and an asset to the team - you get punished. I get punished for being experienced and trying to say "hey maybe if you wanna kite, use the attack move click button" and then get responded to with a "stfu" and I go to all chat to say "report X, he's toxic" and then proceed to have a dialogue in all chat explaining why he is toxic, I get punished. Because that's considered going aggro. Prime example is a game I had today that sealed an account of mine, not this one, oh no, I know the game already. Rengar was upset I picked Sett support. But I got our adc fed, and for some reason he still felt the need to type "Sett is a fucking %%%%" in all chat because he was wrong accusing me in champ select. I did nothing but good for the team and then took to all chat to ask for his report. After that, I proceeded to mute him. But THENNN he stopped jungling for our team. Ignored objectives and afk pushed lanes. He didn't like being ignored or wrong. I told em in all chat what he was doing. But sure enough. After game, boom. Ban. And that wonderful statistic which has been unchanged since my early days of league, was there to greet me prompting this post. 

Kids don't like people who are right or experienced players who try to coach them. They are so sensitive they take offense to your existence and report out of spite (which if Riot didn't want players to do in the first place - 1) probably don't include chat in your game and take a note from Genesis, the console moba, that uses a click wheel instead of chat or 2) finally include team voice), NOT TO MENTION enemy team reports because they just find it funny and wanna watch the world burn. But Riot won't do the actual remedies. Why? It's a simple way to generate money from addicted players who already invested so much time into the game, they can't leave until they decide to pick up another hobby that they can sink 7 years into that is just as addicting. 

I know I outed myself with the admittance of bans, **but observe the replies to this thread and see how many "good hearted" players point that out in attempt to take a shot at me. Those are your toxic players.** There's no need to insult me or my picks. I play support because I enjoy taking weird stuff in the role and throwing people off and after 7 season, yes, I can play any role, but this is where I shine BECAUSE of my picks. 

So to you actual flamers 1) I don't care what a child says to me & 2) I know myself better than anyone, I ain't gonna let someone tell me who I am.

Edit: I always have a high vision score, and I always peel for my team. Those should be the only 2 things that matter in the supp role. But I get players that point out my KDA when I'm not even a carry. They will say 0/4 and ignore the fact that I have 8 assists. The logic of kids at work.

Depends on the language, interpretation, and what is actually included.

There is a difference between players and accounts. We have a digital fingerprint but I'm not sure how well/accurate the system is for separating that.

You have to also account for abandoned accounts since they aren't actually banned, just dormant.

Finally, there is a difference between permanent and suspended. Some accounts aren't banned but locked for security reasons. Some of these get corrected but I'd wager some don't.

0.006% of **accounts** got permanently banned as of when that statistic was created. It has not been reevaluated since then. Given how that statistic will include inactive accounts, accounts banned for not-toxicity (iirc), and will include smurfs (I have 5 accounts and none have received any kind of punishment) I don't think the statistic is so unreasonable... provided you look at it with those caveats.

How about we just do simple math?

80 million players in a given month.

Basically Riot is so greedy and so rich that they dont want to spend the extra money to open centers where people read through reports all day and hand out punishments. Instead they swear up and down this system is foul proof and then when someone comes on here being banned for saying GG EZ. In comes a Rioter to try and make sure everyone still believes the system is good. I remember when the tribunal was around. Sometimes you would get many many chat restrictions before they actually banned you. At some point my buddy got a 100 game chat restriction before they banned him.
